data: PED IR/OR Lumbar Puncture Post Procedure (Multiphase)
Nurse to initiate the Immediate Post Procedure phase. These orders continue on the inpatient unit
Discontinue PED IR/OR Lumbar Puncture Pre Procedure PowerPlan
Provider to enter time of discharge: Discharge Home at:
Do not discharge patient until radiologist assessment
Give Patient information pamphlet on discharge if applicable
Assess as per Anesthetic Care Unit Assessment Standards
q5min, record heart rate, respirations, SpO2, and sedation scale on sedation / analgesia record during and following sedation until pre-procedure level of consciousness is resumed
Measure blood pressure when clinically indicated
Assess as per Anesthetic Care Unit Assessment Standards  policy
In the event of post-procedural bleed of the puncture site, compress firmly with fingers for 10 minutes. If bleeding continues notify treating provider
1 hour post-procedure. If infant then parent may carry the patient
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Post Procedure (Floor) phase of this plan
Monitor lumbar puncture for leakage, bleeding, swelling at 1 hour and 3 hours post
Site: Lumbar Spine, Remove band-aid within 24 hours after procedure
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
